section.name: Import database by using WEB-service.
section.p: Keywords: Import database by using WEB-service.

p.b: * you can not use A-Jetty HTTPS certificate in Internet available version! You can use it on Tomcat only for test import purpose with disabled Internet connection!

section.p: If you decided to move from lite standalone (single user) SQlite version of Beigesoft™ EIS into high load enterprise-ready database MySql, then use WEB-service Import database

Bob decided to checks out this. He installed Apache Tomcat and MySql according https://github.com/demidenko05/beige-accweb README.txt. He download file beige-accweb.war from central Maven repository https://search.maven.org/#search%7Cga%7C1%7Cg%3A%22org.beigesoft%22 and put it into webapps folder of Apache Tomcat. Bob installed Bouncy Castle crypto-provider in static way (see Software installation...), then he copied ajettykeystore.444 file into [tomcat-home]/conf folder and uncommented and changed SSL connector in [tomcat-home]/conf/server.xml:
<Connector port="8443" protocol="org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11Protocol" maxThreads="150" SSLEnabled="true" scheme="https" secure="true" keyAlias="AJettyHttps444" keystoreFile="conf/ajettykeystore.444" keystorePass="**************" keystoreType="PKCS12" keystoreProvider="BC" clientAuth="false" sslProtocol="TLS" />
Bob check out what he can not read server.xml file under his regular account, cause this file hold keystore password.

Bob added ajetty-ca.pem into Java trusted CA keystore:
keytool -import -trustcacerts -alias ajettyca -file "ajetty-ca.pem" -keystore /usr/lib/jvm/java-8-openjdk-amd64/jre/lib/security/cacerts
* on MS Windows open Power Shell as ADMIN in beige-accounting folder and run:
& "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre[version#8]\bin\keytool.exe" -import -trustcacerts -alias ajettyca -file "ajetty-ca.pem" -keystore "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre[version#8]\lib\security\cacerts"
The default password to this keystore is changeit. Adding CA certificate to this keystore requires ROOT permission, so do not worry about keystore password. Never use this keystore to store private keys!
* to import web-store data with S.E. sellers you should at first add S.E. sellers into "Users" and "User Roles" with same names as in source!

He launched SQlite version Beigesoft™ EIS on 8444 port (source local database). Then he started Tomcat and opened address https://localhost:8443/beige-accweb/ He selected Menu -> Admin -> Import database, then entered "URL of WEB-service of source database:" as "localhost:8444/bsa8444/adm/xml" and filled user/password fields then pressed "submit":

Local WEB-server A-Jetty https://127.0.0.1:8444/bsa8444 is not available for cloud (Internet) WEB-application. Apache Tomcat uses Internet-available address, so you data will be Internet-accessible, and you can import data from your Tomcat (on your computer) to Beigesoft™ EIS deployed on any other cloud JEE server. But you can not use A-Jetty HTTPS certificate for it! You must make new HTTPS certificate by yourself that match to your Tomcat Internet address (include application path). You can do it (for example) by using Bouncy Castle Crypto Java API or OpenSSL.
